name: Atrato
headline: Enabling consumers split the cost of purchases without a credit card
description: Enabling merchants and consumers to offer flexibility at the point of sale
generated_description:
Atrato is a fintech company based in Mexico City, founded in 2019 and part of Y Combinator’s W21 batch. With a team of around 80 employees, Atrato has a clear mission: to enable consumers to split the cost of their purchases without needing a credit card. Initially, their focus was on providing flexibility for merchants and consumers alike at the point of sale.

The core service of Atrato allows users to make purchases at affiliate merchants and pay for them in installments—up to 24 months—thereby offering a viable alternative to traditional credit options. This means that customers can buy what they need today and pay over time, providing financial flexibility that can particularly benefit those who may not have access to credit cards.

Their platform caters to a diverse range of purchases, handling everything from bicycles to home appliances. Atrato partners with over 1,000 merchants, making it easy for consumers to find what they want while employing their payment solution.

If you're interested in learning more about how Atrato works or want to explore purchasing options, their website is a great resource: [Atrato Pago](https://www.atratopago.com).

In summary, Atrato is a forward-thinking player in the payments space, aimed at democratizing access to consumer financing in Mexico, all while simplifying the buying process. They highlight convenience, accessibility, and simplicity in their approach, making them a noteworthy option for consumers looking to manage their budgets more strategically.
